# METASTABLE II-CLASS MOTHERSHIP
## 1. Overview
The [color=tan]Metastable II[/color] is built to be as close to a privately owned mobile station as feasible within strict shareholder budget and size constraints, includes docks, cargo, security, engineering, kitchen, botany, chapel, morgue, science, xenobiology, medical, library, Head rooms, crew dorm, janitor, disposals, and a small park.
The restrictive budget did eat into the equipment funds, so the ship may function best with several supporting vessels.
The [color=tan]Metastable II[/color] comes equipped with a locking system controlled by various buttons throughout the ship. Docks and EVA access have nearby controls, and departments have interior and bridge controls. [bold][color=turquoise]Ensure that the bridge lock remote signaller does not fall into the wrong hands.[/color][/bold]
A large portion of power consumption comes from the ship's thrusters, even while not flying. To help save power when the [color=tan]Metastable II[/color] is stationary for an extended time the thrusters can be turned off and on with the [color=gold]caution button[/color] in the bridge.
In an effort to accommodate as many different crews and purposes as possible, lathes and techfabs have not been fully installed. The ship engineer can complete the installation of the remaining machines with a [color=gold]multitool[color] where the crew deems fit.
TCI encourages aftermarket modifications and additions; the [color=tan]Metastable II[/color] comes with a small amount of [color=LightSlateGray]steel[/color], [color=deepskyblue]glass[/color], [color=cornsilk]plastic[/color], [color=gold]gold[/color], and [color=silver]silver[/color] in addition to a large platform outside engineering to serve as a base for large projects.
Flagships are known to be chaotic, especially in high-traffic times when members of many ships are present. It is recommended to organize your crew with contracts and crew or job-based uniform elements from the [color=turquoise]uniform printer[/color] to reduce confusion and mistakes.
To provide salvage, mining, and transportation in absence of a pre-existing network, there is a small selection of ships available to the crew for purchase.
## 2. Usage
[color=tan][bold]S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. Uranium Generator:[/bold][/color]
Ensure portable generator properly installed and shielding operational. Ensure generator fueled with [color=LimeGreen]Uranium[/color] fuel or sheets; and consider loading future fuel onto generator with [color=turquoise]magnet[/color] activated. Tune generator reaction rate to match power consumption with measurements from [color=gold]power monitoring computer[/color] to maximise fuel use.
[color=tan][bold]Atmospherics Distribution Loop:[/bold][/color]
Ensure all [bold][color=seablue]distro line[/color][/bold] and [bold][color=darkred]waste line[/color][/bold] [color=turquoise]pumps[/color] are on, and any [color=turquoise]mixers[/color] feeding the [bold][color=seablue]distro line[/color][/bold] are on and set to [bold][color=dodgerblue]21% Oxygen[/color][/bold] and [bold][color=crimson]79% Nitrogen[/color][/bold].
